text:
Hello,

How do you manage the subdomain cookie in HubSpot? I would like one cookie for <http://www.example.com|www.example.com> and <http://blog.example.com|blog.example.com>.
Is this possible?

Thank you very much,
Anyone know a better way of loading Google Fonts from fields.json? Google doesn't like it
Locally load them... Chrome doesn't cache thr
<https://google-webfonts-helper.herokuapp.com/fonts>
That works fine for as custom font, but I'm talking about the font picker field in the theme settings
Is this for a theme for the market place?
yes
I created a font-loader module.
and used that instead
cause I didnt like the default GF loading
true, that could work. You still used the font field ya?
I did for selecting teh font, but you can tell it not to load the font in the header
yeah. cool thx, I'll look into it. Thank Chad
your welcome.
You can also add HTML into the descriptions so you can link to the tool i showed you.
how can one select the font in the theme settings if it is inside of  a custom module <@U38EZFVFE>?
and i used file pickers in the module so they can load the font into the file manager from the editor
you dont
unless you just dont select the font in theme settings and set in the head instead
i do that as well.
inline the body/html font settings
font family.
so the user has no interface for selecting the font?
the benefit is that becaus eits loaded localy chrome will cache it from page to page
you have to make a choice.
either 100% convenience
or the right way.
google fonts are easy.
Can the CLI be used to edit emails locally? I don't see why not but I don't think I've ever seen it as an example
Only if its a html email template
<@U38EZFVFE> even if I'm just editing modules? I want access to the fields.json file so that I can get additional "default" options
I want to create a larger set of unique defaults
:shrug:
Hello Everyone !

Wondering if someone has any insight into building custom API connections between HubSpot and two other tools below . Or would be easier to go with HubSpot Operations Hub

<https://www.yourmembership.com/|YourMembership> – Syncing personal data (name, email, job specialization) and membership status (free vs paid). 
 <https://www.aventri.com/|Aventri> – Similar approach. Sync personal data and ticket purchase information .
Your question is a little vague, but I imagine custom <#C011F74BKQW|serverless-functions> could help with this

How can we avoid a CORS blockade in content staging? I have custom fonts in a theme’s css file and I’m getting this error:
```Access to font at '<https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/><portalId>/hub_generated/template_assets/XXXXXXXXXXX/XXXXXXXXXXXXXX/<theme-name>/css/styles.min.css' from origin '<https://www>-<domain-name>-<http://com.sandbox.hs-sites.com|com.sandbox.hs-sites.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.```
1.2 KiB blocks half a second :thinking_face: and then the “potential savings” is over half a second? I smell fish

Hi All, anyone else running into issues where every so often a preview page will not open and cites "too many redirects" even when you're logged in? I'm guessing this is an intermittent bug with the updates made that ensure you're now logged in to preview content, but want to see if it's more widespread. I've experienced it across a few portals.
Yeah it's kinda dumb, Google Page Speed is the bane of my existence
Just show the client amazon’s, apple’s, and HubSpot’s page speed score. The big players aint perfect either :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Oh I know... Then Google realeses a blog post all about Core Web Vitals, and everyone looses their mind
This message was deleted.
Hey Drew, I would repost this to our <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel as that would be a better place for this post.
I was looking for it thx

Hi Guys, I am a brand new junior dev that just got hired. I am working on a previously built out module that includes js scripts inside the design manager ide. I am brand new to HubSpot as of today, how can I execute the code and run console logs and such in design manager(trying to see the data objects and variables). Or do i need to set up my local environment and connect the CLI for that. I am the only dev so you guys are my best resource as of now! Any help would be appreciated.

Hi <@U0233UGSH9U> welcome, in the design manager you can preview your templates or modules by clicking the preview button in the top right. You can then inspect the page to look at console logs for JS.

For HubL you can print variables using `{{ variable }}`
Thanks for responding <@U7SL518D6>. I tried printing using HubL and console logging on line 40 and 41. Here is the code.
When I preview the module and look in the console it is empty.
<@U7SL518D6> Am I missing something ?

Hey Lucas - looks like that module is set up to be connected to a hubDB dynamic page. Line 29 above. What you can do to test this module out is just slap it in a test page - then go into the settings tab on the page editor and connect the hubDB table that contains your data. Then you should start seeing some console logs
